courses.customDesc: Any Free Elective course can go here. Recommended: BUS100.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, Lower-Division F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). The USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, or E.

The concentration declaration is due at this time.

Any General Curriculum or Concentration course can go here. Students who choose not to declare a concentration follow the General Curriculum in Economics: Complete at least 8 units 300-400 level ECON coursework plus any 20 units of coursework at 300-400 level.

Any ECON Elective (400 level) course can go here.

Any General Curriculum or Concentration course can go here. Students who choose not to declare a concentration follow the General Curriculum in Economics: Complete at least 8 units 300-400 level ECON coursework plus any 20 units of coursework at 300-400 level.

Choose one of the following: BUS391, ECON395, or CSC101.

Students who take BUS391 (4 units) must also take BUS392 (4 units). Choosing BUS391 & BUS392 will reduce Free Electives to 4 units (vs 8). Students may also substitute ECON395 during the junior year for CSC101 or BUS391 & BUS392.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, Lower-Division F, and GE Elective. Any General Curriculum or Concentration course can go here. Students who choose not to declare a concentration follow the General Curriculum in Economics: Complete at least 8 units 300-400 level ECON coursework plus any 20 units of coursework at 300-400 level.

Choose one of the following: BUS392, or Free Elective

Students who take BUS391 (4 units) must also take BUS392 (4 units). Choosing BUS391 & BUS392 will reduce Free Electives to 4 units (vs 8). Students may also substitute ECON395 during the junior year for CSC101 or BUS391 & BUS392.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, Lower-Division F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). The USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, or E.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR course or GWR exam can go here. Refer to the current catalog for prerequisites.
Any ECON Elective (400 level) course can go here.

Any General Curriculum or Concentration course can go here. Students who choose not to declare a concentration follow the General Curriculum in Economics: Complete at least 8 units 300-400 level ECON coursework plus any 20 units of coursework at 300-400 level.

courses.customId: General Curriculum, Concentration, or Free Elective
courses.customDesc: Any General Curriculum, Concentration, or Free Elective course can go here. Students who choose not to declare a concentration follow the General Curriculum in Economics: Complete at least 8 units 300-400 level ECON coursework plus any 20 units of coursework at 300-400 level.
Choose one of the following: ECON461 & ECON462, or ECON464.

Any General Curriculum or Concentration course can go here. Students who choose not to declare a concentration follow the General Curriculum in Economics: Complete at least 8 units 300-400 level ECON coursework plus any 20 units of coursework at 300-400 level.

Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). The USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, or E.
